Description: Bust of the young Ptolemy VI . (obverse)
Bust of Cleopatra I wearing a 'stephane' (diadem) and veil. (reverse)
Curator's comments: Cleopatra I's depiction closely resembles the coin portrait of her predecessor, the powerful queen Arsinoe II, and is perhaps a conscious echo. The portrait of the young Ptolemy VI strikingly resembles that of his father. The ruler is youthful in appearance, and has a pointed chin and straight, long nose. His hair is short and he wears a diadem, tied behind his head with two straight ends. Cleopatra I wears a 'stephane' (diadem) and veil.
Bibliographic references: Walker & Higgs 2001 / Cleopatra of Egypt: from History to Myth (77)
